project: Convex Performance Fix - Phase 7: Monitoring & Final Validation
description: Day 7: Set up Convex usage alerts, full regression testing, document learnings, verify <1M calls/month trajectory. Final validation before considering free tier downgrade.

documentationReferences: All phase PRDs in this folder

keyFiles: CLAUDE.md - Update with N+1 prevention checklist

userStories.title: Set Up Convex Usage Alerts
userStories.description: Configure alerts in Convex dashboard or external monitoring for function call thresholds.
acceptanceCriteria: Access Convex dashboard for the deployment
Navigate to usage/billing section
Set up alerts at these thresholds:
- 500K calls/month: Warning - 50% of free tier
- 750K calls/month: Alert - 75% of free tier
- 900K calls/month: Critical - 90% of free tier
Configure alert destinations (email, Slack, etc.)
Test alert configuration if possible
Document alert setup in a monitoring doc

technicalNotes.alertOptions: Convex may have built-in alerts or require external monitoring
technicalNotes.fallback: If no built-in alerts, schedule manual weekly review of usage

userStories.notes: Alerts prevent future surprise billing. Critical for staying on free tier.

userStories.title: Update Better Auth to Latest (Optional)
userStories.description: If Phase 1 patch update was successful, consider updating to latest minor version.
acceptanceCriteria: Check if Phase 1 @convex-dev/better-auth update was successful
If successful, consider updating to latest: npm view @convex-dev/better-auth version
Update incrementally: 0.9.x → 0.10.x
Run: npx -w packages/backend convex codegen
Run: npm run check-types
Test login/logout, org switching thoroughly
If any issues, rollback to previous version

technicalNotes.strategy: Only update if Phase 1 update was stable. Cautious approach.

userStories.notes: OPTIONAL - only if confident from Phase 1 update. Skip if any concerns.

userStories.title: Full Regression Test Suite
userStories.description: Execute comprehensive regression testing of all major features.
acceptanceCriteria: Platform staff can manage platform
Org admin can invite users (all roles: coach, parent, admin)
Coach can view assigned teams and players
Coach can create/view voice notes
Coach can view and manage insights
Parent can view children and coach feedback
Player passport displays all sections (skills, injuries, goals, medical)
Organization theming works (colors applied)
Onboarding flows complete successfully
Login/logout works with all auth methods
Organization switching works

technicalNotes.roles: Test as platform staff, org admin, coach, parent

userStories.notes: Comprehensive testing ensures no regressions from all the optimizations

userStories.title: Verify Function Call Reduction
userStories.description: Verify Convex function calls are on trajectory for <1M calls/month.
acceptanceCriteria: Access Convex dashboard usage metrics
Compare current daily/weekly call volume to pre-optimization baseline
Calculate projected monthly calls based on current rate
Target: <900K calls/month (under free tier with safety margin)
Document: Before (3.2M) → After (target ~800K) = 75% reduction
If still over 1M projected, identify remaining high-call functions
userStories.notes: This is the key success metric. Must verify before considering free tier.

userStories.title: Document Learnings in CLAUDE.md
userStories.description: Update CLAUDE.md with N+1 prevention checklist and performance patterns.
acceptanceCriteria: Open CLAUDE.md
Add new section: '## Performance & Query Optimization'
Include N+1 prevention checklist:
- Never query in a loop (Promise.all with queries)
- Collect IDs first, batch fetch, Map lookup
- Use composite indexes for multi-field filters
- Prefer withIndex() over filter()
- Use server-side filtering over client-side
Include common patterns that cause issues
Reference this optimization project as example

technicalNotes.purpose: Prevent future developers from reintroducing N+1 patterns
technicalNotes.format: Match existing CLAUDE.md style and sections

userStories.notes: Documentation prevents future regression. Important institutional knowledge.

userStories.title: Monitor for 24-48 Hours
userStories.description: Monitor Convex function calls for 24-48 hours to verify stable reduction.
acceptanceCriteria: Deploy all changes to production (if not already)
Monitor Convex dashboard for 24-48 hours
Check for any spikes or anomalies
Verify no new errors in logs
Confirm call volume is stable and within target
If stable, project is complete
userStories.notes: Final validation before declaring project complete

userStories.title: Evaluate Free Tier Downgrade
userStories.description: Based on monitoring results, evaluate whether to downgrade from Pro to Free tier.
acceptanceCriteria: Review 48-hour monitoring results
Confirm projected monthly calls < 900K (safely under 1M free tier)
If yes: Document recommendation to downgrade to free tier
If no: Identify remaining optimization opportunities
Present findings to stakeholders
Make downgrade decision

technicalNotes.proFeatures: Review if any Pro features are being used before downgrade

userStories.notes: Business decision based on technical results. May need stakeholder input.

testingStrategy.US-PERF-030: Manual testing of all critical paths

projectCompletionCriteria: Free tier downgrade evaluated and decision documented

nextSteps.ifSuccessful: Consider downgrading to free tier, monitor monthly
nextSteps.ifNotSuccessful: Identify remaining high-call functions, plan additional optimization
